lexUnit.name: packet.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the amount contained in a paper or cardboard container

sentence.text: Keep a packet of pitta bread in the freezer , heat up under the grill from frozen and cut into fingers .
Packets of seeds are much less expensive than florists ' flowers in the long run , but they do cost a lot more in time and effort .

The Food Safety Directorate say that all packets of cling film should carry health warnings .

Having eaten two packets of bacon-flavoured potato crisps , he had purchased another tube of Rowntree 's Fruit Gums , which he was now enjoying while waiting for the lights to dim .

Eventually mother was able to reveal that she gave Suzy a packet of biscuits every time she had an argument with her husband .

He produced a packet of cigarettes , and lit up .
Mitchum , wearing dark glasses , insisted the lights be dimmed , and then threw a packet of cigarettes on to the coffee table .
Out of her black handbag she brings a packet of Silk Cut cigarettes .
